segment.source: How to Deploy the App-V 5.1 Server
segment.target: How to Deploy the App-V 5.1 Server

segment.source: How to Deploy the App-V 5.1 Server
segment.target: How to Deploy the App-V 5.1 Server

segment.source: How to Deploy the App-V 5.1 Server
segment.target: How to Deploy the App-V 5.1 Server

segment.source: Use the following procedure to install the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.1 server.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to install the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.1 server.

segment.source: For information about deploying the App-V 5.1 Server, see About App-V 5.1.
segment.target: For information about deploying the App-V 5.1 Server, see About App-V 5.1.

segment.source: Before you start:
segment.target: Before you start:

segment.source: Ensure that you’ve installed prerequisite software.
segment.target: Ensure that you’ve installed prerequisite software.

segment.source: See App-V 5.1 Prerequisites.
segment.target: See App-V 5.1 Prerequisites.

segment.source: Review the server section of App-V 5.1 Security Considerations.
segment.target: Review the server section of App-V 5.1 Security Considerations.

segment.source: Specify a port where each component will be hosted.
segment.target: Specify a port where each component will be hosted.

segment.source: Add firewall rules to allow incoming requests to access the specified ports.
segment.target: Add firewall rules to allow incoming requests to access the specified ports.

segment.source: If you use SQL scripts, instead of the Windows Installer, to set up the Management database or Reporting database, you must run the SQL scripts before installing the Management Server or Reporting Server.
segment.target: If you use SQL scripts, instead of the Windows Installer, to set up the Management database or Reporting database, you must run the SQL scripts before installing the Management Server or Reporting Server.

segment.source: See How to Deploy the App-V Databases by Using SQL Scripts.
segment.target: See How to Deploy the App-V Databases by Using SQL Scripts.

segment.source: To install the App-V 5.1 server
segment.target: To install the App-V 5.1 server

segment.source: Copy the App-V 5.1 server installation files to the computer on which you want to install it.
segment.target: Copy the App-V 5.1 server installation files to the computer on which you want to install it.

segment.source: Start the App-V 5.1 server installation by right-clicking and running appvserversetup.exe as an administrator, and then click Install.
segment.target: Start the App-V 5.1 server installation by right-clicking and running appvserversetup.exe as an administrator, and then click Install.

segment.source: Review and accept the license terms, and choose whether to enable Microsoft updates.
segment.target: Review and accept the license terms, and choose whether to enable Microsoft updates.

segment.source: On the Feature Selection page, select all of the following components.
segment.target: On the Feature Selection page, select all of the following components.

segment.source: Component
segment.target: Component

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Management server
segment.target: Management server

segment.source: Provides overall management functionality for the App-V infrastructure.
segment.target: Provides overall management functionality for the App-V infrastructure.

segment.source: Management database
segment.target: Management database

segment.source: Facilitates database predeployments for App-V management.
segment.target: Facilitates database predeployments for App-V management.

segment.source: Publishing server
segment.target: Publishing server

segment.source: Provides hosting and streaming functionality for virtual applications.
segment.target: Provides hosting and streaming functionality for virtual applications.

segment.source: Reporting server
segment.target: Reporting server

segment.source: Provides App-V 5.1 reporting services.
segment.target: Provides App-V 5.1 reporting services.

segment.source: Reporting database
segment.target: Reporting database

segment.source: Facilitates database predeployments for App-V reporting.
segment.target: Facilitates database predeployments for App-V reporting.

segment.source: On the Installation Location page, accept the default location where the selected components will be installed, or change the location by typing a new path on the Installation Location line.
segment.target: On the Installation Location page, accept the default location where the selected components will be installed, or change the location by typing a new path on the Installation Location line.

segment.source: On the initial Create New Management Database page, configure the Microsoft SQL Server instance and Management Server database by selecting the appropriate option below.
segment.target: On the initial Create New Management Database page, configure the Microsoft SQL Server instance and Management Server database by selecting the appropriate option below.

segment.source: Method
segment.target: Method

segment.source: What you need to do
segment.target: What you need to do

segment.source: You are using a custom Microsoft SQL Server instance.
segment.target: You are using a custom Microsoft SQL Server instance.

segment.source: Select Use the custom instance, and type the name of the instance.
segment.target: Select Use the custom instance, and type the name of the instance.

segment.source: Use the format INSTANCENAME.
segment.target: Use the format INSTANCENAME.

segment.source: The assumed installation location is the local computer.
segment.target: The assumed installation location is the local computer.

segment.source: Not supported: A server name using the format ServerNamestrong>INSTANCE.
segment.target: Not supported: A server name using the format ServerNamestrong>INSTANCE.

segment.source: You are using a custom database name.
segment.target: You are using a custom database name.

segment.source: Select Custom configuration and type the database name.
segment.target: Select Custom configuration and type the database name.

segment.source: The database name must be unique, or the installation will fail.
segment.target: The database name must be unique, or the installation will fail.

segment.source: On the Configure page, accept the default value Use this local computer.
segment.target: On the Configure page, accept the default value Use this local computer.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you are installing the Management server and Management database side by side, some options on this page are not available.
segment.target: If you are installing the Management server and Management database side by side, some options on this page are not available.

segment.source: In this case, the appropriate options are selected by default and cannot be changed.
segment.target: In this case, the appropriate options are selected by default and cannot be changed.

segment.source: On the initial Create New Reporting Database page, configure the Microsoft SQL Server instance and Reporting Server database by selecting the appropriate option below.
segment.target: On the initial Create New Reporting Database page, configure the Microsoft SQL Server instance and Reporting Server database by selecting the appropriate option below.

segment.source: Method
segment.target: Method

segment.source: What you need to do
segment.target: What you need to do

segment.source: You are using a custom Microsoft SQL Server instance.
segment.target: You are using a custom Microsoft SQL Server instance.

segment.source: Select Use the custom instance, and type the name of the instance.
segment.target: Select Use the custom instance, and type the name of the instance.

segment.source: Use the format INSTANCENAME.
segment.target: Use the format INSTANCENAME.

segment.source: The assumed installation location is the local computer.
segment.target: The assumed installation location is the local computer.

segment.source: Not supported: A server name using the format ServerNamestrong>INSTANCE.
segment.target: Not supported: A server name using the format ServerNamestrong>INSTANCE.

segment.source: You are using a custom database name.
segment.target: You are using a custom database name.

segment.source: Select Custom configuration and type the database name.
segment.target: Select Custom configuration and type the database name.

segment.source: The database name must be unique, or the installation will fail.
segment.target: The database name must be unique, or the installation will fail.

segment.source: On the Configure page, accept the default value: Use this local computer.
segment.target: On the Configure page, accept the default value: Use this local computer.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you are installing the Management server and Management database side by side, some options on this page are not available.
segment.target: If you are installing the Management server and Management database side by side, some options on this page are not available.

segment.source: In this case, the appropriate options are selected by default and cannot be changed.
segment.target: In this case, the appropriate options are selected by default and cannot be changed.

segment.source: On the Configure (Management Server Configuration) page, specify the following:
segment.target: On the Configure (Management Server Configuration) page, specify the following:

segment.source: Item to configure
segment.target: Item to configure

segment.source: Description and examples
segment.target: Description and examples

segment.source: Type the AD group with sufficient permissions to manage the App-V environment.
segment.target: Type the AD group with sufficient permissions to manage the App-V environment.

segment.source: Example: MyDomain\MyUser
segment.target: Example: MyDomain\MyUser

segment.source: After installation, you can add additional users or groups by using the Management console.
segment.target: After installation, you can add additional users or groups by using the Management console.

segment.source: However, global security groups and Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) distribution groups are not supported.
segment.target: However, global security groups and Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) distribution groups are not supported.

segment.source: You must use Domain local or Universal groups are required to perform this action.
segment.target: You must use Domain local or Universal groups are required to perform this action.

segment.source: Website name: Specify the custom name that will be used to run the publishing service.
segment.target: Website name: Specify the custom name that will be used to run the publishing service.

segment.source: If you do not have a custom name, do not make any changes.
segment.target: If you do not have a custom name, do not make any changes.

segment.source: Port binding: Specify a unique port number that will be used by App-V.
segment.target: Port binding: Specify a unique port number that will be used by App-V.

segment.source: Example: 12345
segment.target: Example: 12345

segment.source: Ensure that the port specified is not being used by another website.
segment.target: Ensure that the port specified is not being used by another website.

segment.source: On the ConfigurePublishing Server Configuration page, specify the following:
segment.target: On the ConfigurePublishing Server Configuration page, specify the following:

segment.source: Item to configure
segment.target: Item to configure

segment.source: Description and examples
segment.target: Description and examples

segment.source: Specify the URL for the management service.
segment.target: Specify the URL for the management service.

segment.source: Example: http://localhost:12345
segment.target: Example: http://localhost:12345

segment.source: Website name: Specify the custom name that will be used to run the publishing service.
segment.target: Website name: Specify the custom name that will be used to run the publishing service.

segment.source: If you do not have a custom name, do not make any changes.
segment.target: If you do not have a custom name, do not make any changes.

segment.source: Port binding: Specify a unique port number that will be used by App-V.
segment.target: Port binding: Specify a unique port number that will be used by App-V.

segment.source: Example: 54321
segment.target: Example: 54321

segment.source: Ensure that the port specified is not being used by another website.
segment.target: Ensure that the port specified is not being used by another website.

segment.source: On the Reporting Server page, specify the following:
segment.target: On the Reporting Server page, specify the following:

segment.source: Item to configure
segment.target: Item to configure

segment.source: Description and examples
segment.target: Description and examples

segment.source: Website name: Specify the custom name that will be used to run the Reporting Service.
segment.target: Website name: Specify the custom name that will be used to run the Reporting Service.

segment.source: If you do not have a custom name, do not make any changes.
segment.target: If you do not have a custom name, do not make any changes.

segment.source: Port binding: Specify a unique port number that will be used by App-V.
segment.target: Port binding: Specify a unique port number that will be used by App-V.

segment.source: Example: 55555
segment.target: Example: 55555

segment.source: Ensure that the port specified is not being used by another website.
segment.target: Ensure that the port specified is not being used by another website.

segment.source: To start the installation, click Install on the Ready page, and then click Close on the Finished page.
segment.target: To start the installation, click Install on the Ready page, and then click Close on the Finished page.

segment.source: To verify that the setup completed successfully, open a web browser, and type the following URL:
segment.target: To verify that the setup completed successfully, open a web browser, and type the following URL:

segment.source: http://Management server machine name:Management service port number/Console.html.
segment.target: http://Management server machine name:Management service port number/Console.html.

segment.source: Example: http://localhost:12345/console.html.
segment.target: Example: http://localhost:12345/console.html.

segment.source: If the installation succeeded, the App-V Management console is displayed with no errors.
segment.target: If the installation succeeded, the App-V Management console is displayed with no errors.

segment.source: Got a suggestion for App-V?
segment.target: Got a suggestion for App-V?

segment.source: Add or vote on suggestions here.
segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.source: Got an App-V issue?
segment.target: Got an App-V issue?

segment.source: Use the App-V TechNet Forum.
segment.target: Use the App-V TechNet Forum.
